subjects.element: Helm of Wrath — Tier 2 Warrior great helm
subjects.details: A breathtaking full-face great helm forged from polished blue steel, the pinnacle of warrior armor craftsmanship. STRUCTURE: The helm has a rounded dome crown with a prominent central ridge running from the forehead to the nape, rising into a tall golden crest. The face is protected by a full plate construction with a narrow T-shaped visor slit — a horizontal eye slit intersected by a vertical nasal bar, both edged in gold. The cheek guards are broad and sweep downward to protect the jaw, each with an embossed golden dragon scale motif. The entire helm surface is polished blue steel — a distinctive cold blue-tinted metal with an almost mirror-like sheen in the highlights that fades to deep navy in the shadows. DRAGON WING ORNAMENTS: The defining feature — two magnificent golden dragon wings rise from the temples of the helm, one on each side. Each wing is an ornamental plate shaped like a stylized dragon wing with three to four elongated pointed pinions sweeping backward and upward. The wings are burnished gold with engraved feather-scale texturing, each pinion edged with a slightly brighter gold. The wing bases connect to the helm at ornate golden rosette mounts. These wings add dramatic width to the helm's silhouette, extending outward and upward impressively. GOLDEN CREST: A tall golden crest rises from the central ridge of the helm — a tapered blade-like fin of gold that curves slightly backward. The crest is engraved with a dragon motif in relief — a sinuous dragon body winding upward. The crest catches light brilliantly, serving as the topmost point of the helm. TRIM AND DETAILS: All edges of the blue steel plates are bordered with fine gold trim — the eye slit, the jawline, the crown ridge, the neck flare. Three small gold studs run along each cheek guard. The steel surface shows not battle damage but master polish — subtle reflective variations that read as carefully maintained ceremonial armor. The inside of the visor slit reveals controlled darkness — deep shadow but not the absolute void of the T1 helm, suggesting the refined interior padding of a lordly helm.
subjects.scale: The helm fills the icon frame generously — the wing tips extend to near the frame edges, establishing a wide majestic silhouette

subjects.details: A rich, regal purple glow (#a335ee) emanates from the helm, stronger and more saturated than a rare blue glow. The aura is most intense along the golden elements — the wing tips, the crest peak, and the gold trim lines — as if the enchantment lives within the gold itself. The purple glow extends approximately 8-10% of the frame into the dark background, creating a prominent luminous halo. The glow has a subtle warm quality within the purple spectrum, leaning slightly toward magenta at the brightest points near the gold. This is the signature epic-quality item glow from World of Warcraft, immediately communicating to any player that this is a coveted epic drop.
subjects.scale: The glow creates a noticeable aura halo around the entire helm, with intensified bloom at the wing tips and crest

camera.shot_type: Flat frontal icon view with subtle three-quarter rotation to show dimensional depth of the wings
camera.angle: Eye level, 10-15 degree rotation to viewer's left, allowing both dragon wing ornaments to read clearly in the silhouette
camera.lens_equivalent: 85mm equivalent — flat orthographic feel, no perspective distortion
camera.focal_point: The visor slit and golden nasal bar — the face of the helm, then the eye traces upward along the crest and outward along the wings
camera.depth_of_field: Infinite — entire helm in razor-sharp focus, only background glow is soft
composition_rules: Item centered in frame with the crest peak near the top edge
Dragon wing tips define the horizontal extent, creating a wide impressive silhouette
Golden crest creates a strong vertical axis from visor to crown
The T-shaped visor serves as the visual anchor point at center-frame
Epic purple glow creates a natural luminous border framing the composition

lighting.key_light: Strong directional light from upper-left at 45 degrees, cool white (6000K), designed to maximize the polished blue steel's reflective qualities. Creates a sweeping bright highlight across the left half of the dome, the left dragon wing, and the left cheek guard. The blue steel responds with brilliant cold reflections.
lighting.fill_light: Warm golden ambient fill from lower-right at approximately 25% intensity, picking up the gold detailing on the shadowed side and preventing the right wing from disappearing into darkness. This fill also gives the gold trim on the right side a warm glow.
accent_lights: Epic-quality purple rim light (#a335ee at 50% intensity) outlining the entire helm silhouette — strongest at wing tips and crest peak, creating the characteristic epic glow edge
Golden self-illumination from the ornamental elements — the wings, crest, and trim appear to emit a faint warm gold light of their own, as if enchanted
Sharp specular pinpoints on the polished blue steel — bright white-blue dots at the dome peak, the nasal bar tip, and the cheek guard curves
lighting.shadows: The blue steel creates beautiful gradient shadows — transitioning from bright sky-blue highlights through medium navy to deep blue-black in the recesses. The underside of each dragon wing casts a soft shadow on the dome crown. The interior of the visor is shadowed but not absolute black — a deep navy suggesting depth. Gold elements maintain warmth even in shadow.
atmospheric_fx: Epic purple glow aura: rich diffuse bloom radiating outward from the helm's silhouette, strongest at golden elements and protrusions
Faint purple-white sparkle motes: 3-4 tiny brilliant sparkle points near the helm, brighter and more numerous than rare-quality sparkles
Gold element self-luminosity: subtle warm glow from within the golden wings and crest, as if containing captive dragonfire
Blue steel reflection mapping: the polished surface reflects hints of the purple glow and gold elements, creating complex color interactions across the metal
